Introduction to R, an SWC-like Workshop

introduction_to_R.Rmd

King’s College London

14th, 21st and 28th April 2021
2:00 am - 5:00 pm

Instructors: Rohit Goswami, Sanjay Fuloria, Annajiat Alim Rasel
Helpers: TBD

Lesson pre-requisites

Please ensure you have the latest version of R and RStudio installed on your machine. This is important, as some packages used in the workshop may not install correctly (or at all) if R is not up to date.

You may refer to this link for an easy-to-follow tutorial on how to install these softwares on your computer.
Note: Please skip the section on Install required R packages for this workshop.

Lesson schedule


Timings Topic Details
Day 1 [14th April, Wed]
13:30-14:00 Pre workshop set up Instructors/helpers available to make
sure participants have installed correct files and packages
14:00 - 15:30* 1. Introduction to R and RStudio How to find your way around RStudio?
How to interact with R?
How to manage your environment?
How to install packages?
15:30 - 15:45 Break
15:45 - 16:30* 2. Project Management With RStudio How can I manage my projects in R?
16:30 - 17:00* 3. Seeking Help How can I get help in R?
Day 2 [21st April, Wed]
14:00 - 15:15* We probabaly need an intro to dataframes here? What lesson would you use?
15:15 - 15:30 Break
15:30- 17:00* 5. Data frame Manipulation with dplyr How can I manipulate data frames without repeating myself?
Day 3 [28th April, Wed]
14:00 - 15:45* 6. Creating Publication-Quality Graphics with ggplot2 How can I create publication-quality graphics in R?
15:45- 16:00 Break
16:00 - 17:00* Insert another lesson here, or have an open session for questions and problems?

Assessment

The Carpentries value a culture of assessment, and we are consistently evaluating our workshops to understand the impact workshops have on our learners, and how we can improve our content delivery.

We conduct pre and post workshop surveys for each workshop

  • Pre-Workshop Survey
  • Post-Workshop Survey
